name: Ace Hotel and Swim Club

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just had 5 days at the Ace in Palm Springs with the family up at the La Quinta Resort and Club. Our fist time at the Ace it proved to be an excellent choice and respite from a full family villa vacation north of PS. The resort is laid back cool and very relaxing. The rooms are smart, functional and styled for relaxation. The bed was amazingly comfortable. What I noticed is the Ace spent money where it counted with this chilled resort – beds, linen, excellent food, drinks and great service. The Service at the resort is excellent from front desk, pool service, restaurant and maid service. The clientele is a diverse selection of Angelino’s from couples on there first weekend away to hipster families chilling by the pool. The Pool Muzak is awesome. I would recommend this resort to anyone who wants a relaxing break from LA.
reviews.title: The Ace always a hole in One!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay was amazing! We had such a great time at the beautiful pool. This was the ultimate place for relaxing... people watching... but the scene was different then your usual trendy hotel (which we really appreciated). Coming from Seattle, I would refer to the crowd as "hipster mania". Fedoras everywhere... lots of vintage bikinis... and a "who cares" attitude. The rooms were clean and very refreshing considering it was so hot outside. There were two pools onsite, one was more popular then the other... which was nice... if you wanted to just chill go to the smaller pool. Great current, but unexpected music played all day long. OH and the HAMMOCKS... we spent every evening in the hammocks... with misters going and faint sounds of music and pool life... the hammocks were an instant favorite. The hotel restaurant was an old 1960's Denny's redone... and redone well. It feels like a Denny's but its so nice... great combo. The booths are recovered in real leather and the fare is delightful and not diner food at all. The only thing that I didn't care for was the taxidermy animals in the glass case above the front desk... haha.... but avoidable and humorous. I would highly suggest this hotel. Sexy, relax, fun, and sceney but not hypocritical. Will be back for sure.
reviews.title: Perfect for a funky couple

reviews.text: I went to the Ace to get away and celebrate my birthday. It was recommended by one of my clients and after looking at the many hotel possibilities...I decided on the Ace...the best decision ever! I went by myself and met some great people when I wanted to and was able to be by myself when I needed to . The energy and vibe was so positive and the staff always had a smile on their face and were eager to please. Not an ounce of pretentiousness or bad attitudes made for such a positive experience. The music played at the pool and spun by the DJs was some of the most relaxing and toe tapping music I have heard at a pool...not one bubble-gum pop song was played...ahhhh...so wonderful. The rooms were unique and very comfortable...along with being affordable. The people that were there all had a laid-back quality...they were there to enjoy the sun and each other...not too rowdy...but a lot of fun. It is a great mix of rockers with a lot of tattoos...along with a mixture of sun worshippers. I would go back every weekend...if I did not have to work!!! :)
reviews.title: The best mini-vacation I have ever had!!!

reviews.text: My kids said, it looks like Urban Outfitters. I found this hotel on the internet on Sunday morning, made a reservation and we were here in the afternoon for a 3 day stay. We had a room just steps from the main pool -- very convenient. The average temperature has been about 106 during the day so the pool water is almost too warm. Plenty of chaise lounge chairs around the main pool and hammocks. It was never too crowded.
reviews.title: Good value, trendy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The housekeeping service was a little spotty. The housekeeping staff came by the first day at 8:00 a.m., a little too early. We expected them to come back later but they did not return. It was not big problem, but we did need to call the front to get additional toilet paper and to get some extra towels.
reviews.title: Fun Weekend

reviews.text: Ace is trying so hard to be a cool, hipsters hangout.
reviews.title: Too Cool for Skool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything is geared with style over substance in mind. Whilst it is no bad thing, you just need to be prepared.
reviews.title: So relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For us Brits it is like Brighton but concentrated into a small area.
reviews.title: Spring Break atmosphere
you get better service as a prisoner on a pirate ship
reviews.text: Rooms are very quirky and comfortable. Just be aware that it is a converted motel so noise levels are pretty high.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Enjoyed the stay. Would stay again but only if we got a good rate.
reviews.title: Hip, chill party vibe. Great low maintenance, happy crowd.
Totally unique, fun experience
reviews.text: I have to say this has been a better hotel experience than many 5-star hotels I stayed with. While the room decor is not luxurious, it is original and tasteful, right down to the working record players (and seventies records!). The DJ by the pool, the diverse, fun group of guests and the relaxed ambience made me never want to leave! The only downside was that there were a couple of non-guests who made their entrance into the pool area (with kids frolicking around in the pool) made me feel a little bit bitter about paying the $20 resort fee. In general, I really dislike the way US hotels pile on the extras. But the original price was by far the lowest we paid across all the hotels we stayed in California..

Stayed for one night for a bachelorette party in mid-May. Service was beyond dreadful. Overpriced. Overcrowded. The staff was more interested in socializing with one another than attending to the guests. Food disgusting. Ended up with food poisoning. Avoid at all costs. NOT WORTH THE MONEY. The desert is full of luxury locations for less money. Can't say one good thing about this place. AVOID. AVOID. AVOID.
reviews.title: HORRIBLE. HORRIBLE. HORRIBLE.

reviews.text: Good location for a base for the Palm Springs area. Reception staff are very courteous, but cleaner forgot to do the room. Rooms can be noisy, we stayed here for 3 nights, Friday & Saturday had weddings so were disturbed during the night. This hotel has humour, fantastic 'Survival Guide' for the hotel & it's facilities. The rooms are well designed, fantastic shower and free wi-fi (we think). Pool open until 2am, very nice touch as we're not used to this heat. If you're young and trendy this could be the hotel for you.
reviews.title: Good base for the area, staff courteous, facilities good

reviews.text: I've now stayed at the Ace twice, once for a relaxing birthday overnighter during the cool season with girlfriends, and a second time for both work and fun while I was covering the Coachella festival for my magazine.
reviews.title: A very cool hotel that may even be serene on the right weekend.

reviews.text: The Ace has a way of making both sorts of trips rewarding. When it was cool, we enjoyed great food at the restaurant, and attentive service. My birthday-girl friend got no fewer than three free celebratory desserts in 12 hours! Not a soul by the pool on a gray day. Downright tranquil.
reviews.title: Cool vibe, friendly staff and comfortable
still good even with spotty service
reviews.text: It's clear that the Ace Palm Springs is probably at 70-80% of what the owners envisioned, in terms of service, but even at 70% it is still a great place to go to relax poolside for a few days. They have some cute hip servers, but it can be hard to place orders-- you sort of have to wait around and hope someone comes by eventually.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The basic format of the hotel is highly conducive to relaxation-- lots of air, space, light, and a minimum of clutter. It reminds you of why desert and beach motor hotels were so popular once-- all play, no business. Noise could be an issue on a busy weekend, so I recommend going to the Ace during the week when it seems to be much less busy (and cheaper).
reviews.title: Pleasant Trip to the Desert

reviews.text: They run some cool programs at night in the bar-- karaoke, bands, etc., so on a good night you don't even need to leave the hotel. Make sure to do some walking on the wide streets around the hotel at sunset. The view of the sun going down behind the purple mountains is fantastic.
reviews.title: I was extremley dissapointed with the...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was an overall awesome weekend. Hotel staff was very friendly, especially Nicole and Cesar at the front! The food at the restaurant was reasonably price and tasty. The hotel itself has a very fun and happening vibe. The movies shown outside are also a really fun activity. i loved that the pool was open so late too. Thanks Ace, I will most definitely come back.
reviews.title: Great hotel - wish I could have enjoyed it!

reviews.text: I was extremley dissapointed with the service and the staff. I have enjoyed my stay previous times, great location and a very bohemian atmosphere. I will NOT be returning to this hotel or will I reccomend this hotel to anyone
reviews.title: One year later....a little battered and bruised

description: Dine at King’s Highway, drink at the Short Bus, late night at the Amigo Room, swim at the Club, massaged in a Mongolian Yurt.
